description: Chersonesos was an ancient Greek colony founded in the southwestern part of the Crimean Peninsula, ancient Taurica. Settlers from Heraclea Pontica established the site in the sixth century B.C.
details: The site was inscribed as a property on the UNESCO World Heritage list in 2013 as the "Ancient City of Tauric Chersonese and its Chora".

names.description: A shortened version of the name of the site, securely attested in Procopius and the only name used for the site in Greek sources from the end of the Early Byzantine period until its abandonment.

history.comment: added Greek version of name, description, sources, removed temporal attestations that are not supported by evidence
